ARABIC: وَمَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: His wealth will not help him when he plummets to the depths.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And his riches will not avail him when he falls headlong (into the Abyss).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and their wealth will be of no benefit to them when they face destruction.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: His wealth will not avail him when he falls into ruin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And what will his wealth avail him when he goes down (in destruction)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And his wealth will not avail him when he perishes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: his wealth shall not avail him when he perishes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: His riches will not save him when he perisheth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: nor will his wealth profit him when he falls [into the pit].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And his substance will avail him not when he perisheth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: His wealth will not avail him when he perishes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong (into the Pit).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And what will his wealth benefit him when he goes down (in destruction).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When he falls (into Hell), his wealth will not help him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And his money will not avail him when he plummets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [92:11] And his wealth shall not (mā is or negation) avail him when he perishes, in the Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (His riches) which he amasses in the life of the world (will not save him when he perisheth) when he dies; and it is also said this means: when he is cast in the Fire.
